questions.question: Which of the following sheet is larger in size?
questions.explanation: A0 is the largest sheet in the ISO A series with an area of 1 square meter.

questions.question: Harder grade pencils are denoted with B, 2B, 3B, 4B, etc.
questions.explanation: B grades are softer and darker; harder pencils are denoted by H series.

questions.question: What is the primary unit of measurement for engineering drawings?
questions.explanation: Engineering drawings use millimetres as the standard unit for precision.

questions.question: What is the angle set between the scales of the drafter?
questions.explanation: The scales in a mini drafter are fixed at 90° for orthogonal line drawing.

questions.question: A set square is used in combination with a T- square to draw horizontal lines.
questions.explanation: The set square rests on the T-square to guide horizontal and vertical lines.

questions.question: Which of the following angle is not possible to be made using a single set square?
questions.explanation: 75° is not a standard set square angle and needs combination of two tools.

questions.question: The main visible outlines of a drawing are represented by _______.
questions.explanation: Visible outlines are shown with thick continuous lines to stand out clearly.
